articles.headline: Putin, Xi and Modi Meet on Camera, but With No Signs of Greater Unity
articles.snippet: At a virtual summit meeting of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, the leaders of Russia, China and India each focused on their own driving issues.
articles.abstract: At a virtual summit meeting of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, the leaders of Russia, China and India each focused on their own driving issues.
articles.lead_paragraph: The leaders represented the three biggest powers bidding to reshape a global order dominated by the United States, convening over video feeds at a virtual summit meeting on Tuesday. But beyond the unity implied by their joint appearance, each seemed focused on his own, different aim.
articles.byline: By David Pierson, Anatoly Kurmanaev and Sameer Yasir

articles.headline: Federal Judge Limits Biden Officials’ Contacts With Social Media Sites
articles.snippet: The order came in a lawsuit filed by the attorneys general of Missouri and Louisiana, who claim the administration is trying to silence its critics.
articles.abstract: The order came in a lawsuit filed by the attorneys general of Missouri and Louisiana, who claim the administration is trying to silence its critics.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal judge in Louisiana on Tuesday restricted the Biden administration from communicating with social media platforms about broad swaths of content online, a ruling that could curtail efforts to combat false and misleading narratives about the coronavirus pandemic and other issues.
articles.byline: By Steven Lee Myers and David McCabe

articles.headline: Jenin Has a Long Legacy as a Bastion of Palestinian Armed Struggle
articles.snippet: In the northern reaches of the occupied West Bank, near the boundary with Israel, Jenin and its refugee camp have nurtured an ethos of defiance.
articles.abstract: In the northern reaches of the occupied West Bank, near the boundary with Israel, Jenin and its refugee camp have nurtured an ethos of defiance.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Israeli forces hunted for wanted men, weapons and explosives in the Palestinian refugee camp in Jenin this week, after using aerial drones to blow up what they described as terrorist hubs there, the city was living up to its reputation as a center of militant defiance in the occupied West Bank.

articles.headline: The Ukraine War Changed This Company Forever
articles.snippet: Nokian Tyres of Finland made 80 percent of its tires in Russia, where energy was cheap. After losing billions, it prioritized political security over business efficiency.
articles.abstract: Nokian Tyres of Finland made 80 percent of its tires in Russia, where energy was cheap. After losing billions, it prioritized political security over business efficiency.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even with sheets of rain falling, the sprawling construction site was buzzing. Yellow and orange excavators slowly danced around a maze of muddy pits, swinging giant fistfuls of dirt as a chorus line of trucks traipsed across the landscape.

articles.headline: ‘Dig, Dig, Dig’: A Russian Soldier’s Story
articles.snippet: An inmate hoped to start over with a clean slate by fighting in Ukraine. Instead, he was confronted by the drudgery of trench work and the terror of battle. “You’re going in as meat,” he said he was told.
articles.abstract: An inmate hoped to start over with a clean slate by fighting in Ukraine. Instead, he was confronted by the drudgery of trench work and the terror of battle. “You’re going in as meat,” he said he was told.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Russian soldier was captured only days after arriving on the front line in eastern Ukraine. He had little training. But he knew how to disassemble and fire his rifle and where to put a tourniquet.
articles.byline: By Thomas Gibbons-Neff and Natalia Yermak

articles.headline: How to Deal With Financial Trauma
articles.snippet: Experiences like economic hardship or medical expenses can distort people’s feelings and behaviors around money, causing them to sabotage their financial futures.
articles.abstract: Experiences like economic hardship or medical expenses can distort people’s feelings and behaviors around money, causing them to sabotage their financial futures.
articles.lead_paragraph: Rahkim Sabree owns a home in Hartford, Conn., invests and has money in savings. But that isn’t always enough to make him feel secure. Unexpected expenses, regardless of the cost, bring him discomfort.

articles.headline: It’s a World of Inflation
articles.snippet: Prices are still rising too fast for comfort in many major economies, and policymakers across the globe are trying to wrestle them under control.
articles.abstract: Prices are still rising too fast for comfort in many major economies, and policymakers across the globe are trying to wrestle them under control.
articles.lead_paragraph: From Melbourne to Manchester to Miami, people are struggling under the weight of hefty price increases for the things they buy each day.
articles.byline: By Karl Russell and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: China Took Her Husband. She Was Left to Uncover His Secret Cause.
articles.snippet: He was brilliant, quirky and intensely private — and also, she now suspects, an anonymous dissident blogger who had won fame for years of evading the surveillance state.
articles.abstract: He was brilliant, quirky and intensely private — and also, she now suspects, an anonymous dissident blogger who had won fame for years of evading the surveillance state.
articles.lead_paragraph: It wasn’t as if Bei Zhenying didn’t know that her husband was unusual, or even that he had some secrets.

articles.headline: As Businesses Clamor for Workplace A.I., Tech Companies Rush to Provide It
articles.snippet: Amazon, Box, Salesforce, Oracle and others have recently rolled out A.I.-related products to help workplaces become more efficient and productive.
articles.abstract: Amazon, Box, Salesforce, Oracle and others have recently rolled out A.I.-related products to help workplaces become more efficient and productive.
articles.lead_paragraph: Earlier this year, Mark Austin, the vice president of data science at AT&T, noticed that some of the company’s developers had started using the ChatGPT chatbot at work. When the developers got stuck, they asked ChatGPT to explain, fix or hone their code.
